context.p:
The following steps outline the long-hand process of using the IHTSDO Workbench IDE to construct a new concept refset
In more recent versions of the Workbench, a Refset creation 'wizard' ( an executable business process ) guides you through the process of creating a refset. For further information about this wizard, see

step.cmd: Ensure that Preferences Settings are appropriate for Refset creation.
Determine the appropriate name for the refset, observing any editorial policies.
Create the member refset concept using the Component Panel.Either the add new concept button or the clone concept button can be used.
Create the associated parent member refset concept using the Component Panel.
Create the associated specification refset concept using the Component Panel.
Load the member refset concept into the special Refset Specification tab of the Component Panel.
Create the refset specification expression using the supported Query Language constructs available from the right-click enabled pop-up choice box.
Compute the refset membership from the specification using the compute refset button. This can take some time to process. Progress is displayed in the separate Activity Viewer window.

Visually check the content of the refset using the hierarchy view of the Component Panel. Refset members are denoted by a paper clip ; parents and ancestors of the members are displayed by a pin . For large refsets, more extensive review processes will be warranted.
